Table.Description: This table shows the distribution of measured ping-pong latencies for all node-to-node communication links in the cluster.
Table.Name: Link Latency Histogram

Columns.Column: Number of links measured within this interval

Information.Message: A "Warning" assessment indicates that at least one node is performing poorly relative to the other nodes in the cluster. A poorly performing node meets both of the following criteria: 1. Average latency/throughput over all network links for the node is at least one standard deviation away from the mean value for the cluster. 2. Latency is at least 20% higher or throughput is at least 20% lower than the cluster mean. This avoids unwarranted Warnings on highly uniform cluster networks.
Packet size for determining latency: 4 Bytes
